meanings.definition: To cause or allow (a liquid) to flow over the edge of its container.
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to spill the milk while pouring it into the glass.
meanings.sent2: The water started spilling out of the cup when it was too full.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled the juice all over the table, making a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were spilling out of her like a waterfall, uncontrollable and overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The paint can was spilling its contents, creating a colorful puddle on the floor.

meanings.definition: To flow or run over the edge of a container.
meanings.sent1: The river was spilling over its banks after heavy rain.
meanings.sent2: The hot soup was spilling from the bowl onto the table.
meanings.sent3: The excitement in the room was spilling over, filling the air with energy.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter spilled out of her, contagious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The tears were spilling down her cheeks, reflecting her sadness.

meanings.definition: To scatter or spread (objects) untidily over a surface.
meanings.sent1: She was spilling her toys all around the room, creating a mess.
meanings.sent2: The papers were spilling out of the folder, disorganized and chaotic.
meanings.sent3: The students were spilling out of the classroom, eager to start their break.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were spilling out of his mind, jumbled and confused.
meanings.sent5: The seeds were spilling from the bag, ready to be planted in the garden.
